posts.post_content:
This card is so good for getting out early powerful cards like, [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus), [Time Stretch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stretch), [It That Betrays](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=It That Betrays), [Darksteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Colossus), [Ulamog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ulamog), [Emrakul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul), [Autochthon Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Autochthon Wurm), [Pathrazer of Ulamog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Pathrazer of Ulamog), [Plague Wind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Wind), [Searing Wind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Searing Wind), [Eternal Dominion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eternal Dominion), [Kozilek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kozilek), [Krosan Cloudscraper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krosan Cloudscraper), etc, etc, etc.  
  
Epic card.  
  
  
  
5/5

Posted By: Fert12334 (1/25/2011 5:12:31 PM)

posts.post_content:
In case you're going to build a deck around her, there are two related DailyMTG articles, look up "Jhoira Goes Up".  
  
Her main uses are the follows:  
1) Bring out expensive spells  
2) Use suspend cards that profit from the effect  
either a) Those with high suspend countdown ([Nihilith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nihilith), [Deep-Sea Kraken](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deep-Sea Kraken), [Greater Gargadon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Greater Gargadon) or [Heroes Remembered](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heroes Remembered))  
and/or b) Those who give a profitable effect while suspended (those are most above mentioned cards, or those with X-cost, being [Aeon Chronicler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aeon Chronicler) [Roiling Horror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Roiling Horror), [Benalish Commander](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Benalish Commander), [Fungal Behemoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fungal Behemoth) and [Detritivore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Detritivore).  
3) Prepare some delayed, but tough storm effects  
  
She also combines nicely with cards that let the suspended cards being cast quicker by removing time counters, such as [her timebug](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=118879), [Rift Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rift Elemental)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
In case you're going to build a deck around her, there are two related DailyMTG articles, look up "Jhoira Goes Up".

Her main uses are the follows:
1) Bring out expensive spells
2) Use suspend cards that profit from the effect
either a) Those with high suspend countdown (Nihilith, Deep-Sea Kraken, Greater Gargadon or Heroes Remembered)
and/or b) Those who give a profitable effect while suspended (those are most above mentioned cards, or those with X-cost, being Aeon Chronicler Roiling Horror, Benalish Commander, Fungal Behemoth and Detritivore.
3) Prepare some delayed, but tough storm effects

She also combines nicely with cards that let the suspended cards being cast quicker by removing time counters, such as her timebug, Rift Elemental... (see all)

@DarthKithkin:

posts.post_content: Need some help here. So I suspend an [Inkwell Leviathan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inkwell Leviathan), a [Wake of Destruction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wake of Destruction), and a [Dragonstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragonstorm). Would I be able to storm the Dragonstorm twice? I don't know if after suspending, I can cast the cards in the order that I want. The rules aren't clear, any assistance with this would be helpful. Thanks.
posts.html:

Posted By: MindSculptor (2/12/2011 9:35:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Because "cast" is the same as "play" when it comes to spells, you can't use her to get around epic limitations (though perhaps you could use her to cast two epic spells simultaneously, while one is still on the stack?).
posts.html:
Because "cast" is the same as "play" when it comes to spells, you can't use her to get around epic limitations (though perhaps you could use her to cast two epic spells simultaneously, while one is still on the stack?).

posts.post_content:
When using her, always leave ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol) open, so that if she gets kill'd, you can revenge-suspend Emrakul. No-one will want to kill her next game.  
  
She also lets you cast stuff at instant speed via [Timecrafting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timecrafting) or the Timebug or [Clockspinning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clockspinning) or [Rift Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rift Elemental) or whatever. This is cool.
posts.html:
When using her, always leave open, so that if she gets kill'd, you can revenge-suspend Emrakul. No-one will want to kill her next game.

She also lets you cast stuff at instant speed via Timecrafting or the Timebug or Clockspinning or Rift Elemental or whatever. This is cool.
